name: A Zeo Beginning Quiz | TV for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the main villain in the episode?
questions.explanation:
King Mondo.

	King Mondo was in charge of the Machine Empire. He came in as a new, more powerful villain than Rita and Zedd, who had been the villains in "Mighty Morphin Power Rangers".

questions.text: In the opening scene the Command Center was destroyed.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It was a rehashed scene from the end of the previous series, showing a bomb going off under the building and destroying it. The scene wasn't complete archive footage, as the Rangers were then shown digging through the rubble. At the same time, in space, the Machine Empire was moving in to replace Rita and Zedd.

questions.text: As the Zeo crystal only has enough power for five Rangers, which member of the team chose to pass on his or her chance at continuing as a Power Ranger?
questions.explanation:
Billy.

	There were five returning Power Rangers from the previous series, and Tanya who had returned from Africa in place of Aisha, making six potential new Rangers. Billy chose to let Tanya join the team so he could serve in an advisory capacity instead of fighting on as a Ranger. He stayed mostly in the command center where he tinkered and built new zords, weapons and other gadgets for the Zeo Rangers.

questions.text: Who became the leader of the Rangers as they took on their Zeo powers?
questions.explanation:
Tommy.

	While Kat was Zeo Ranger I, the pink Ranger was not in charge of the team. Tommy, as Zeo Ranger V served as the team leader. He wore a red suit. Rocky, the former red Ranger, turned Zeo Ranger III, wore a blue suit and served as second in command of the team.

questions.text: What did Skull give to Bulk as a gift?
options: A photo of the power rangers
questions.explanation:
A motorcycle.

	The two were working as members of the Junior Police Force. The characters were introduced in this season as Skull gave Bulk a surprise gift, which turned out to be a motorcycle with a side car. The bike was in serious need of repair, but would eventually be used on patrol for the duo.

questions.text: Alpha 5 was destroyed and replaced by a new model in this episode.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Several seasons later Alpha 5 would be replaced by Alpha 6, but for the "Power Rangers Zeo" season the smaller robot remained the same from the previous seasons. He served as the hands and feet of Zordon, who was trapped in a non-corporeal form and couldn't do things in the physical world.

questions.text: Which Ranger was the first shown to be fully morphed in a Zeo suit?
questions.explanation:
Kat.

	The costumes were vastly different than they had been in the previous seasons. Their helmets, rather than being all basically the same, with hints of the dinosaur they represented worked in, had geometric shapes in the visors. The Rangers were each shown morphed in order of their number: pink, yellow, blue, green and red.

questions.text: Which villain among the options given lost his memories and ended up working as a butler for Bulk and Skull?
questions.explanation:
Goldar.

	Goldar and Rita's brother, Rito, both lost their memories when they blew up the Command Center. As the rest of their team escaped the galaxy running from King Mondo, they were left on Earth with no memory of who or what they were. Bulk and Skull took advantage of that and put them to work.

questions.text: What were the soldiers in the robot army called?
questions.explanation:
Cogs.

	The Cogs were the troops used by the machine empire. They served the same purpose as the Putty Patrollers had in the previous seasons of the show.  Fighting the Cogs was the first interaction between the Machine Empire and the Rangers.

questions.text: What piece of nostalgia lined the walls in the Power Chamber?
options: Photos of the villains the Rangers have defeated.
Pictures of the Rangers as children.
questions.explanation:
The "Mighty Morphin" power suits.

	The Command Center was destroyed, in its place the Power Chamber was created. (Though the establishing shots still showed the old Command Center every time they were inside the Power Chamber.) Viewers didn't get much of a chance to see the details of the Power Chamber until near the end of the episode. As the Rangers morphed into the their Zeo suits for the first time, the background is shown. All six (no green Ranger) of the "Mighty Morphin" Ranger suits are displayed in recessed chambers in the wall.
